definition[0]: the real or imaginary line that marks the edge of a state, country etc, or the edge of an area of land that belongs to someone
example[0]: National boundaries are becoming increasingly meaningless in the global economy.
example[1]: We would need their agreement to build outside the city boundary.
example[2]: The stream curves round to mark the boundary of his property.
example[3]: Anything that crosses the boundary of a black hole cannot get back.
example[4]: We walked through the churchyard towards the boundary wall.
example[5]: The propertyâ€™s boundary line is 25 feet from the back of the house.
example[7]: The Mississippi River forms a natural boundary between Iowa and Illinois.
definition[1]: the limit of what is acceptable or thought to be possible
example[8]: within the boundaries of the law
example[9]: art that pushes back the boundaries
definition[2]: the point at which one feeling, idea, quality etc stops and another starts
example[11]: the boundaries between work and play
example[12]: the blurring of the boundaries between high and popular culture
definition[3]: the outer limit of the playing area in cricket, or a shot that sends the ball across this limit for extra points
example[13]: Big companies usually aim to expand outside national boundaries.
example[14]: About 10% of hazardous waste is shipped across international boundaries.
example[15]: The new housing estates stretch beyond the old city boundaries.
example[16]: the southern boundary of San Francisco
example[17]: Today satellite communications cross all geographical boundaries.
example[18]: Reforms could extend the geographical and political boundaries of the EU.
example[19]: Here, the Andes form a natural boundary between Argentina and Chile.
example[20]: The river Jordan marks the boundary between Israel and Jordan.
example[21]: These are practical problems that cross political boundaries.
example[22]: The boundary wall was about twenty foot high.
example[23]: There was some disagreement about the exact position of the boundary line.
example[24]: We had to hire a lawyer to sort out the boundary dispute.
